article.headline: Colorado 94, Pepperdine 77
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. (AP) -- Shaun Davis shot six for six, dealt six assists, had five steals and scored 20 points to lead Pepperdine to a 94-77 victory over Colorado Monday. Terrance Johnson added 16 points and Jesse Pinegar 14, as Pepperdine evened its record to 1-1. After trailing 42-41 at halftime, the Waves gained the lead in the first minute of the second half on a jumper by Glen McGowan and never fell behind again. Davis' 3-pointer midway through the second half gave the Waves a 67-57 lead, and Pinegar's 3-pointer increased the Pepperdine margin to 80-65 with 5:36 remaining. The Buffaloes never made a serious run in the second half and dropped to 1-1 for the season. Colorado's David Harrison led all scorers with 30 points. Harrison pulled down eight rebounds and blocked six shots before fouling out of the game with 1:20 left. Colorado built a 41-33 lead with 1:46 left in the first half, but the Waves outscored the Buffaloes 8-1 over the remaining moments of the half and trailed 42-41 at the break. Buffaloes' coach Ricardo Patton received his second technical foul of the game with 2:25 to play and was automatically ejected from the game.
